docs.lead_paragraph: Enrollments in the nation's schools and colleges have grown steadily for nearly three decades. But figures released last week indicate a tapering off that could bring better teaching conditions and less pressure on taxpayers but harder times for college faculties.

headline.main: Now the Era of No-Growth; Enrollment:

docs.abstract: F M Hechinger article revs HEW Dept study released this wk on increase in enrollment in nation's schools and colls by 0.5%, smallest margin in 28 yrs
